es.ull.iis.simulation.core
Class SimulationPeriodicCycle

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.core.SimulationPeriodicCycle
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulationCycle
public class SimulationPeriodicCycle
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimulationCycle

A wrapper class for PeriodicCycle to be used inside a simulation. Thus TimeStamp can be used to define the cycle parameters.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

Constructor Detail

SimulationPeriodicCycle

public SimulationPeriodicCycle(TimeUnit unit,
                               TimeStamp startTs,
                               SimulationTimeFunction period,
                               TimeStamp endTs)
Creates a new cycle which runs until the specified timestamp is reached.

Parameters:
unit - Time unit used in the simulation
startTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to start
period - Time interval between two successive ocurrences of an event
endTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to finish

SimulationPeriodicCycle

public SimulationPeriodicCycle(TimeUnit unit,
                               TimeStamp startTs,
                               SimulationTimeFunction period,
                               int iterations)
Creates a new cycle which runs N times.

Parameters:
unit - Time unit used in the simulation
startTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to start
period - Time interval between two successive ocurrences of an event
iterations - How many times this cycle is executed. A value of 0 indicates infinite iterations

SimulationPeriodicCycle

public SimulationPeriodicCycle(TimeUnit unit,
                               TimeStamp startTs,
                               SimulationTimeFunction period,
                               TimeStamp endTs,
                               SimulationCycle subCycle)
Creates a new cycle containing a subcycle which runs until the specified timestamp is reached.

Parameters:
unit - Time unit used in the simulation
startTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to start
period - Time interval between two successive ocurrences of an event
endTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to finish
subCycle - Subcycle contained in this cycle

SimulationPeriodicCycle

public SimulationPeriodicCycle(TimeUnit unit,
                               TimeStamp startTs,
                               SimulationTimeFunction period,
                               int iterations,
                               SimulationCycle subCycle)
Creates a new cycle containing a subcycle which runs N times.

Parameters:
unit - Time unit used in the simulation
startTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to start
period - Time interval between two successive ocurrences of an event
iterations - How many times this cycle is executed. A value of 0 indicates infinite iterations
subCycle - Subcycle contained in this cycle

SimulationPeriodicCycle

                               long endTs)

Parameters:
unit - Time unit used in the simulation
startTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to start expressed in unit
period - Time interval between two successive ocurrences of an event
endTs - Relative time when this cycle is expected to finish expressed in unit
